name: Suomenlinna
description: 18th-century sea fortress spread across six islands

name: Helsinki Cathedral
description: Iconic neoclassical church overlooking Senate Square

name: Temppeliaukio Church
description: ‘Rock Church’ hewn directly into solid rock

name: Esplanadi Park
description: Popular green promenade between Market Square and Parliament

name: Market Square (Kauppatori)
description: Harborfront stalls selling berries, fish, and souvenirs

description: Historic indoor market with gourmet Finnish delicacies

name: Oodi Central Library
description: Striking modern library and community hub

name: National Museum of Finland
description: Exhibits on Finnish history from Stone Age to present

name: Kiasma
description: Museum of contemporary art in a bold modernist building

description: Creative event space with street art and concerts

name: Design Museum
description: Finland’s largest collection of design and applied art

name: Ateneum Art Museum
description: Classic Finnish and international art collections

name: Leningradsky Café
description: Soviet-era décor and Russian dishes in Kallio

name: Hakaniemi Market Hall
description: Local fish, produce, and ethnic food stalls

name: Kumpula Botanic Garden
description: University-run gardens showcasing Arctic and alpine plants

description: Historic rides and roller coasters with free entry

name: Helsinki Zoo (Korkeasaari)
description: Nordic wildlife and exotic species on an island park

description: Traditional Finnish wooden buildings relocated to an island

description: Museum and café dedicated to the Moomin creator

name: Seaside Cycling Route
description: Scenic bike path along the South Harbour

description: Artist studios and exhibitions in a former naval facility

description: Ferris wheel offering aerial city and sea panoramas

description: Climb to tower top for views of Helsinki’s grid layout

description: Orthodox church with striking red brick façades

description: Jog through city landmarks with a local guide

name: Löyly Sauna
description: Architect-designed public sauna by the sea

description: Heated pools with waterfront city vistas

description: Traditional wood-fired public sauna in Kallio

description: Boat trip to offshore navigation towers

description: Murals and graffiti in the bohemian district

description: Boutique shops and galleries focused on Finnish design

description: Exhibits on Finland’s wartime history in Helsinki

description: Former home of Marshal Mannerheim with period rooms

description: Historic stone theatre hosting Finnish plays and performances

description: Annual festival of design exhibitions and talks
